page.title: 13A SCHOOL DAY IN GLADESTRY
page.content: On a school day we get up at 7.50am. We have wheatflakes and toast for breakfast. We feed our gerbil, clean our teeth and make our beds. We go down to school in the car. Before school we play games or chess. School starts with assembly, except Friday when we go swimming at Knighton. Then we do maths until playtime. After play we do English or some sort of writing until 12 o'clock. Then we have dinner in school. After dinner we have 40 minutes play. In the afternoon we do history, geography, games, art, or sometimes we go for walks or have a special visitor. We go home at 3.20pm. We go home in the car, but sometimes we walk across the fields. We play until suppertime. Most children watch a lot of television, but we do not. We go to bed about 8pm. Mum reads to us.
